Detailed Description

An interface of a synapse.

Definition: A synapse is a connection between two neurons.

Member Function Documentation

void NeuralNetwork.Synapses.ISynapse.Connect ( ISynapse  synapse  ) 

Parameters:
synapse The synapse to be connected.

Implemented in NeuralNetwork.Synapses.Synapse, and NeuralNetwork.Synapses.SynapseDecorator.

void NeuralNetwork.Synapses.ISynapse.Connect (  ) 

Connects the synapse.

A synapse is said to be connected if: 1. it is aware of its source neuron (and vice versa), and 2. it is aware of its target neuron (and vice versa).

Implemented in NeuralNetwork.Synapses.Synapse, NeuralNetwork.Synapses.SynapseDecorator, and NeuralNetwork.Teachers.BackpropagationTeacher.BackpropagationSynapse.

void NeuralNetwork.Synapses.ISynapse.Disconnect ( ISynapse  synapse  ) 

Parameters:
synapse The synapse to be disconnected.

Implemented in NeuralNetwork.Synapses.Synapse, and NeuralNetwork.Synapses.SynapseDecorator.

void NeuralNetwork.Synapses.ISynapse.Disconnect (  ) 

Disconnects the synapse.

A synapse is said to be disconnected if: 1. its source neuron is not aware of it (and vice versa) and 2. its target neuron is not aware of it (and vice versa).

Implemented in NeuralNetwork.Synapses.Synapse, NeuralNetwork.Synapses.SynapseDecorator, and NeuralNetwork.Teachers.BackpropagationTeacher.BackpropagationSynapse.

void NeuralNetwork.Synapses.ISynapse.Initialize (  ) 

Initializes the synapse.

Implemented in NeuralNetwork.Synapses.Synapse, NeuralNetwork.Synapses.SynapseDecorator, and NeuralNetwork.Teachers.BackpropagationTeacher.BackpropagationSynapse.
